website_summaries.verdict: A quality option that can withstand tough conditions without malfunctioning so you can get the shot you want.
pros: Users trust the Olympus brand, and this model comes with features that make capturing moments easier
WiFi capabilities make sharing photos simple
Shockproof, crushproof, and freezeproof to impressive limits makes it a tough camera
New and seasoned photographers both love the underwater shooting modes, giving more opportunities for amazing photos
cons: The video quality does not match the photo quality

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera for snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this camera for underwater snorkeling photos. Have tried many throughout the years, none as easy to use, reliable, holds a charge, and takes beautiful pics. Love not replacing batteries, just plug in at end of day. Super easy to change settings under water. For a point and shoot this is a great underwater camera. I don't usually write reviews but was so happy with this I felt I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: lens cover scuffed easily
customer_reviews.text: The lens cover scratched the first trip. It got badly scuffed and I only took it out of my life jacket pocket a few times, BUT the most aggravating thing is that Olymous does not sell a replacement part even though the plastic piece is held on by three screws and would be easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kerry

customer_reviews.title: A good waterproof camera - better than all the competition - with RAW (essential for serious photos)
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof, sensible double locks on compartments, reasonable lens, reasonable picture, and RAW format. I had a waterproof Nikon Coolpix, but water got in when I thought it was locked closed (but it was merely shut) - that couldn't happen with this camera because of the better door design. As far as I can tell, this is the best point-and-shoot waterproof camera available.
customer_reviews.author: MorganR

customer_reviews.title: Great vacation camera
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small camera to take on a cruise and shoot some underwater photos and video. This was just what I was looking for. Certainly didn't want to lug around my 5DMKIV all around the Caribbean. Shooting underwater was fantastic. The controls were easy to manipulate underwater. Most of the photos were really good and the video was nice as well. Anyone who thinks that the image quality of any point and shoot is as good as a DSLR like the MKIV or MKIII is delusional, but then again I can't submerge a DSLR underwater like the TG-5. For vacation snap shots it fits the bill nicely.
customer_reviews.author: jwmshp456

customer_reviews.title: Connector Cover Design Flaw?
customer_reviews.text: Takes great images and video, above and below water, but after only about 20 minutes of snorkeling (but several hours of "dry" use), the connector cover over the USB/HDMI ports popped open, destroying the camera. I've owned several cameras over the years, taking them in and out of my pockets and backpacks and not once has one of their covers opened without me manually opening it. And yes, I ensured that both locks were engaged before entering the water. On the good side, the SD card survived.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S.

customer_reviews.title: This camera was recommended as one of the best waterproof cameras around
customer_reviews.text: This camera was recommended as one of the best waterproof cameras around. I bought it for snorkeling, and it takes incredible pictures. I’ve also had great pictures of sunsets, up close flowers, and the camera is very easy to operate. The expedition guides on UnCruise Adventures use this camera (but the older model tg-4), and you can imagine the abuse their cameras get. I can’t say enough about this wonderful camera.
customer_reviews.author: jrcat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a cruise vacation where we planned to do some shallow dives. It is an excellent camera! Works fantastic underwster and on land. Very feature rich and easy to use. There are so many options that it can take a bit to find them all. Being able to shoot in RAW + JPG is a must and this camera has it. Love it, love it, love it. It has taken quite a bit of abuse and has even gone down to 50 feet on several occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO CHEAP... Not "Tough" Enough!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is listed as "tough" and boy is that NOT the case. I can't believe a camera at this cost could be so cheap. Macro is no good either, just as a side-note. Despite keeping it entirely safe from harm, this camera has chipped EVERYWHERE. I'm pretty appalled... The glass screen on the back chipped in multiple places. I can't believe the low quality. Skip this camera and get something else. I've only had it for 3 months and it already looks trashed. SO DISAPPOINTED. I think the only good thing about this camera is that it takes underwater photos - but so do half of the other cameras at this price on the market. Nope. Say no.
customer_reviews.author: snanna

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Well built - a little heavy for it's size. Photos taken are what I expected from a small camera like this. Really like the water proof capability. Battery use is heavy. Make sure you purchase extra batteries and a battery charger so you have battery backup in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Able

customer_reviews.title: Won't Shut Off
customer_reviews.text: This camera never shuts off. Even when you turn off GPS in three places, it still drains the batter in a few days. The only way you can have a useable battery when you need it is to leave it plugged in all the time it is not in use. I have contacted Olympus and finally talked them into sending a new battery - which did not work much better. Since neither the dealer or Olympus will buy it back, I will never buy an Olympus camera again. They are GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Tubac

customer_reviews.title: Photo quality just doesn't cut it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this camera and went to great effort to get the best possible picture quality (including downloading their obscure raw extension for Lightroom which was a pain). I am quite experienced with cameras and in the past shot with a high end full frame canon in a water housing. Given that is a high bar, but the picture quality on this thing just sucks. Your photos will look like they were taken on a digital camera from 2005. Really shocking that for this price Olympus can't produce a better image sensor. Your iphone takes photos that are far superior than this camera. Therefore, I am selling mine and getting an axisgo case for my iphone.
customer_reviews.author: D. Turin

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, till it gets wet!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TG 5 camera because my Olympus TG 4 had water damage after the battery door opened. Now, with my new TG 5, on the first snorkel of my 10 day snorkeling trip in Roatan, there was water behind the lens! The door was still double locked, but it was totally wet inside. These small cameras take wonderful photos, and i love all the features! BUT there is definitely a problem with the water proofing! Have it in for “repair”, will keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Great all-condition and water camera
customer_reviews.text: I sea kayak with this in my vest pocket. It gets dunked in salt water regularly. Picture quality is what you'd probably expect from such a compact with short lens. I'm no professional, but think general candid shots look great. It turns on and focuses super fast, important for my use of it. Lens is recessed which is nice to protect it if you don't use a proper case, which to me defeats the purpose of this camera type. Oh, button and frame layout work well for one hand and glove use.
customer_reviews.author: Sticky wicket

customer_reviews.title: Was not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I own an Olympus TG-2 Waterproof camera and have been very pleased with it. The newer TG-5 has some new features and I decided to upgrade. Unfortunately the newer version does not appear to be of the same quality as its earlier version. I found the compartment doors to be less reliable, which are critical to maintain the waterproof integrity of the camera. On the very first try in a pool, the camera failed to take underwater pictures. The battery compartment door alert goes on and off intermittently. I am returning the camera.
customer_reviews.author: FV3000

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but battery would not hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: From right out of the box the battery would not hold a charge. I'm a long-time Olympus customer, and use the cameras for commercial real estate. The TG-2 model of this camera was great and lasted for many years until I dropped it, but this one has a major problem with the battery. Update - I called tech support and they recommended a new battery, which solved the problem. One star for shipping an expensive camera with a bad battery upgraded to three stars for fixing the problem but it took a couple of days to figure out the problem and get the new battery. Summary - great camera, bad quality control on batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This camera is not “tough” it is a total PANSIE
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera white water rafting- had it tethered to my life jacket and was weary by a wrist strap. One big wave and the water proof compartments were all popped open (they had all been properly locked) thereby flooding the camera and completely destroying it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 3 weeks. Great, crisp picture quality for small camera, excellent settings, easy to use. Have not tested it underwater yet, but went snowmobiling in yellowstone in early feb. and it definitely help up to its freezeproof standards (temperature varied between 15-20 degrees F and I would record video while riding in the back, wind blowing and all, for extended periods, as well as drop it in snow) My only minor complaint is the video button is hard to press with a thick glove on (they could make it protrude out a little bit in future versions).
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This is a truly amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: It's waterproof to snorkeling depth Optical stabilization is great. Macro performance is surprisingly good. Flash is "strong enough" The menu is well laid-out and intuitive The camera's ergonomics are great (for a very small camera). Usually when I go on a major vacation, I take 2 cameras - my "fancy" one (in my case Sony A7R3) and a "lifeboat" just in case the main camera bursts into flames, or otherwise malfunctions. This one, unless I want huge blow ups, is great. I may even use it as a main camera, since it fits in a shirt pocket just fine. My only reservation is that it lacks a viewfinder. In VERY bright sunlight the viewscreen is good, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Decent for underwater but needs a lot of extras to protect it.
customer_reviews.text: Not tough by itself. Body and screen scratch VERY easy. Should come with the lens adapter, cover, jacket, screen protector and case for this price. Performance has been pretty good otherwise. We were able to get some cool pictures in the pool and at the beach, but don't expect "normal" photos any better than what you can get with a modern smart phone. User guide recommends sending it in to be serviced once a year to maintain being waterproof. Time will tell how that holds up.
customer_reviews.author: cdaug

customer_reviews.title: Seal failed twice; lost water resistance
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item two years ago. Less than a year into ownership, it lost its seal and water got into the system. They repaired the item under warranty. However, here it is, less than a year later after being repaired, the seal failed again and the camera is ruined. However, they will not honor the warranty. We use the camera for going to the lake and similar activities. This camera isn’t being mishandled. Will not be purchasing this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Meadowlark

customer_reviews.title: poor image quality
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for a small waterproof camera to take with me in places where i don't want to take the DSLR. Alas, even though the camera has nice features - like accessory telephoto and fisheye lenses and 'live composition' mode, the test photos i took (using auto mode so it was doing the work) came out with very poor image quality. I pulled them off into the 'olympus viewer' and they looked very grainy, like a very high iso would. Had to return it - didn't want to risk traveling half way around the world just to have crummy 'instamatic' images....
customer_reviews.author: JadeJ

customer_reviews.title: A great camera for the fly fisher.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a waterproof camera I could take on the river when I'm fishing. My other one isn't waterproof and I've been known to take an unscheduled swim now and then. This one the bomb! Great little pocket camera. You can take nice shots of your fish IN the water and UNDER the water. If your into bugs, entomology, this thing takes great micro photos. It has 4K and HD video for the action shots, too. It also just takes beautiful shots period. Great for the trail, backpack or kayak or canoe.
customer_reviews.author: Chased by a BearTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pics (in and out of water)
customer_reviews.text: We got this for a trip to the Galapagos. My wife used it for all her pics on land and while snorkeling. It really is waterproof, in case you don't believe it. Handled the salt water fine (we rinsed in fresh water after every use). Pictures were really good!! Sea turtles, fish, sharks!! It was a nice size for all our adventures. Not a lot of zoom, but we knew that going in. Worked exactly as advertised and we'd definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lightfoot

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Has amazing quality, but has some features, like GPS, which really arn't needed. I'm so impressed with it that I now rarely use my Canon Rebel SLR. The Canon SLR is just too bulky to lug around when traveling. The Olympus TG-5 fits nicely and inconspicuously on my belt. The lens is wide enough, without the bulky fish-eye attachment. The resolution is strong enough so that a telephoto lens is seldom if ever needed. I like the ease of switching from flash to no flash. Other functions are not as intuitive. In my opinion too expensive to risk using it in salt water. Salt water ruins everything.
customer_reviews.author: Ruplinger

customer_reviews.title: Very durable, very good photos
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a snorkeling trip and it took some very nice photos underwater. It was my first non-disposable underwater camera so I was a bit hesitant to dunk it in the water at first, but it worked. The photos of course aren't as crisp as a more expensive model you may get, and I've never had a GoPro so I can't compare to that, but for my purposes they were very good and well worth the money not to have to worry about it getting damaged.
customer_reviews.author: dannyt

customer_reviews.title: lens cover scratched on first outing
customer_reviews.text: So this is supposed to be a tough camera, right? The clear plastic waterproof cover that sits in front of the lens got scratched the first time I used this thing. Not badly enough to degrade picture quality, but now I know that I have to be pretty careful with this thing. I think that if they aren't going to use a hard, scratch resistant material like mineral crystal then they should supply this thing with a lens cap. Just don't drop it face-down on gravel. You'll be sorry. Other than that, it's a reasonably good camera for travel. Doesn't take videos with auto-focus like my cell phone, which is a bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Takes fantastic pictures. Screen scratches  easily.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cause i do a lot of things near water or in rough environments work wise like kitchens or on the beach. It takes fantastic pictures with great detail. Im still learning all the mechanics. One thing i will definitely recommend if you buy this is BUY A SCREEN PROTECTOR. I didnt have mine 2 days before it managed to scratch itself in my back pocket. Either on a button or a zipper. The screen glass protrudes past and of the buttons, so if you lay it down on its back, it will probably scratch. Other than that, great camera. totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: It's a camera!
customer_reviews.text: I had a rugged camera from a different brand in the past, and this one is leaps and bounds better in my opinion in terms of image quality and features. I decided that I needed a new toy, and used the excuse of having a baby on the way to convince my wife that I should buy this camera. I have captured some very special memories with this camera so far, and didn't have to worry about erupting placenta waterlogging my new purchase. Very good image quality for a point and shoot camera, good macro functionality, very feature rich camera. Does have limited options for lens attachments.
customer_reviews.author: C A

customer_reviews.title: Poor functionality
customer_reviews.text: Zoom is weak. Doesn't bring objects much closer. Flash operation is faulty. It was flashing outside on a bright cloudy day then I went inside an it wouldn't flash in a dark closet. Not a very wide angle lense. Battery charger indicator goes to half charged then the camera shuts off, it may be fully charged though, not really sure. If I start the charge process again it showed one line and charges all over again. They need to go back to the drawing board with this one.
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for macro and underwater!
customer_reviews.text: Takes amazing macro shots and fits in my pocket! Easy to use and connect with my phone wirelessly. This is the best purchase I’ve made in a while. Highly recommend if you want to take macro or underwater shots. Check out some of the tags for this camera on instagram to see the underwater shots people take with it. I think it’s a good travel camera too though the main highlights are macro and underwater for sure.
customer_reviews.author: jendorbell

customer_reviews.title: Relatively fragile. Won't charge. Won't connect via USB
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera less than a year ago for the macro option, which is great. Camera dropped from desktop to floor about one month and a half ago, which cracked the screen all the way across, so I find the "tough" statement to be incorrect. Additionally, starting about two weeks ago, the camera will no longer connect to computer via USB. I have to remove the card and put it in camera. Very inconvenient. Starting yesterday, the camera will not charge. I wouldn't waste my money on this based on quality.
customer_reviews.author: It's Totally Minis

customer_reviews.title: Great Macro, good all around camera.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my business mostly as I take lots of macro shots this gives great close ups to wear your almost touching the article your photographing. there is just one thing I dont like, the plug in slot for hooking up to your computer is right next to the hinged door and since the plug in is lower down makes it difficult to plug in. I hate that as Im constantly unplugging and plugging in. But other than that Im happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Critic is me

customer_reviews.title: Card error
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Got the camera it would not read the sd card. I even went out to buy a new sd card just in case it was an issue with my old one. Nope. Nothing would work. Unfortunately I wasn’t able to return this in time for my trip. Very disappointed Need to return camera Update: I sent it to get repaired and it was just sent back to me saying it was cleaned and repaired but it still doesnt work. i am not able to take a picture as it keeps saying card error. Not sure who to contact. what a disaster. i want my money back..
customer_reviews.author: Judith Traynham

customer_reviews.title: great little camera under the water
customer_reviews.text: An amazing little camera for under water and even for above the water. It is quite sophisticated with the ability to fine tune your picture taking; I was too occupied with ensuring I wasn't going to die while snorkeling (first time) to deal with it...but the pictures I obtained were pretty darn awesome! My friends told me to put the dial on "fish" which is pretty much how I shot the pics the entire time--again---too busy occupied with floating and not sinking. Not that I was...but heck...it was the ocean, in the Galapagos, with fish, birds, reptiles, turtles and more birds. It was awesome, and the camera proved it.
customer_reviews.author: CiaoBella

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Compact and durable. This camera is like a 3/4 of a gopro with a more focus on photo. The video quality is pretty solid. This is a fantastic amateur lifestyle/photojournalism camera. Throw it in your bag, get caught in the rain.... who cares. Take photos or video in the pouring rain! By eliminating the stress of the elements this camera is fun and carefree. Keep your phone in a lifeproof case and use the TG-5 to capture the moments and share them. The wifi to phone feature inst as complicated as the reviews lead on.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there
customer_reviews.text: The video and still photos were remarkable. I did a ton of research before buying this unit, between the GoPro, Nikon and Canon this unit was easy to use, well manufactured and produced great images. It was easy to navigate the controls while diving and out of the water was exceptional. We dove in Turks and Caicos to about 20 feet, I had it in the water for 7 hours at a time and no leaks, great battery life just overall a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gdk Surround Inc.

customer_reviews.title: one tough camera indeed
customer_reviews.text: Used this camera in Iceland through rain, snow, sleet, hail and even a good soak in a geothermal hot spring in 100 degree silica and salt rich water for a couple hour and it still worked perfectly. Waterproofing and durability are bar none. It has a wide range zoom good for anything from ultra wide landscape to close up portrait shots. Picture quality is good in daylight but nighttime photos can be blurry and lackluster though still better cell phones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little guy for when you don’t want to schlep the DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade for my previous adventure camera. Could not be happier with the product. The quality is great, speed excellent, battery life solid, low light quality much improved from my 10 year old Nikon. Everything I complained about with the Nikon this has solved. My only annoyance is that there’s only an option for a strap on one side. Would’ve wanted strap mounts on both sides but this will do given that it is otherwise perfectly behaved.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah M

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this camera. Purchased it because of its underwater capability (where it did an impressive job!), but was even more impressed with the quality of normal pictures. The user interface is intuitive and the various scene modes were very helpful both in underwater and conventional photography. Never written a recommendation before (and I buy a lot of high tech equipment), but was so pleased with this camera that I felt compelled to share my experience. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: b powers

customer_reviews.title: My best ever camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is really the best camera I have ever owned! It takes excellent photos and it fits in my purse! I never wanted a camera with rechargeable batteries but as it turns out, this one lasts on forever on a single charge. I haven't dropped it 'yet' but it does seem to be tough. I would recommend this camera to anyone and everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Gail M. Scriver

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, Amazon repair service horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Camera is great, does everything it needs to and more. I upgraded from a GoPro to this one, and once you get over the learning curve, you will take awesome pictures. One huge issue is you better get the warranty for the camera, as Amazon repair services was zero help and took my camera back then did nothing, forcing me to buy a second one. I should have gotten the warranty but trusted Amazon, big mistake! They didn't even send back the broken camera, just kept passing me from customer service bot to bot.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought same camera new last year for $299 from Best Buy. It flooded (on its own, no ports were wet) just after warantee expired. BUT, I loved it so much, I've bought another. This time I went for a refurbished because the price has risen dramatically! New-$450. Refurbished-$350. Again so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: smsmac

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but watch your depth
customer_reviews.text: Best underwater-ready camera. Macro works well. If you're diving you may want to get the housing because 55' can sneak up on you in a hurry. It does provide an on-screen warning message, but audible would be better. I took a lot of nice pictures during a recent vacation.
customer_reviews.author: QuickShopper

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.text: Thoroughly enjoy using this camera, both in the great out doors and on the city streets. I have NOT had an opportunity to use it indoors or in wet conditions yet. I will update later if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: two zero

customer_reviews.title: Zoom is limited
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera but the zoom is very limited Use it for home inspection in crawl spaces where other cameras break when a little dirt gets on them Raining outside I don’t have to worry about the camera getting wet If they could improve the zoom image i would give it another star rating
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it was simply amazing! The photos this thing take and the 4k ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this all over our honeymoon scuba diving, and snorkeling... it was simply amazing! The photos this thing take and the 4k video is beyond words.... Def. get this, but make sure to get the fastest memory card so it shoots quickly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Priestley

customer_reviews.title: Takes a Beating and keeps on Clicking
customer_reviews.text: What a great little camera. It has all the features of a DSLR minus the interchangeable lenses, but it’s perfect for someone that gives it rough treatment. My 8 year old grandson is a typical kid, and knocks it around, drops it, and loves it. He’s learned to keep it on Program or Auto mode for great images. As he gets older, we’ll go deeper into it. Great little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: roughness
customer_reviews.text: The camera does everything you are expected from it. One thing in particular I have not been able to use is the WiFI. Hopefully I'll figure out how it works. But in general the photos and videsos are splendid.
customer_reviews.author: alberto rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I was afraid I'd get lower quality pictures since it is a waterproof camera, but the pictures were fine.
customer_reviews.text: Made our trip to the beach easier to photograph. Takes great pictures and doesn't mind a little salt, water of sand as long as you follow the simple instructions. I was afraid I'd get lower quality pictures since it is a waterproof camera, but the pictures were fine. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Swan

customer_reviews.title: Average pictures to bad pictures. Incredibly overrated.
customer_reviews.text: Takes average photos and lower quality snorkeling pictures. (I am comparing it to gopro 3+ with underwater housing which I love.) I would not buy the Olympus TG-5 again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: I really looked around for a good quality underwater camera. I don't like the go pros fishbowl look so I found this one and I love it. Battery does last most of the day but if you plan on making videos I would bring a back up battery just in case. It was also super easy to transfer photos to my phone using the Olympus app.
customer_reviews.author: DaphneFox

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are great, videos are OK - main complain is that ...
customer_reviews.text: bought to take pictures during a trip to the beach & pool. Pictures are great, videos are OK - main complain is that there is way too much noise from the microphone. i've lowered it's recording level, but can still hear zooming in & out, along with my breathing and any wind noise - my old Cannon of 10 years didn't have those issues. If not for the video, would have given 4/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: dimanyc

customer_reviews.title: WoW! Got for it.
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This is the must so far. I got this cam after a bad experience with the DC 2000 Sealife and now I'm in the even. the microscope config is so good. I'm work on a coral project in Costa Rica and I can tack macro pics with out extra lens. Thanks Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Daniel Richard Paradis

customer_reviews.title: Preforms as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Have had the Olympus TG5 in the pool and camping at Flaming Gorge UT, In the lake and down the river, haven't dropped it yet but have bumped it around pretty well. Holding up well so far. Pictures are fantastic in full sun in or out of the water, will be trying the night features, probably with a tripod, later in the month in Moab. Big fan of the Tough cameras, just wish Olympus provided a little better support for the older versions, currently rebuilding my TG860, love the flip screen.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Very good pictures until it failed
customer_reviews.text: Very good pictures until one day when it decided it didn’t want to work anymore. The local camera shop says that’s a problem of all cameras similar to this, from all the bands. At some point water gets past the seals and then it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Stays on the settings you choose
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the TG-4 it won't change from water to something else. I was using the TG-4 while my wife was using the TG-5 while snorkeling in semi-rough water (for snorkeling) and every time I needed to take a shot I had to change the settings on the TG-4 The TG-5 held its settings even while the snorkeler was tumbled by waves a few times . The dial for changing configuration settings is recessed a bit so it won't change which a little wave bouncing around the snorkeler.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hutson

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Solid camera. Great for casual photographers who want to take their camera everywhere. Takes shots quickly and pictures come out fairly clear. Amazingly long battery life. So much fun to take into the water! One tip: Buy a screen protector. I was thankful I did the first time I dropped it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda F.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: Great amateur underwater camera. We actually have no plans to use it underwater, but its nice to be in the water with friends and not have to worry about dropping it and ruining it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: GPS ability
customer_reviews.text: My primary purpose for this camera was to document species quickly. I previously had a Nikon coolpix camera with GPS capability. Not only did the Nikon display satellite strength to let me know how good of a GPS signal I had (which the Olympus does not do), the Nikon was WAY faster. Getting the GPS to connect continues to take so long that this camera has now become nearly obsolete to me. Additionally, when you zoom in, on occasion, you will get a purple "haze" in the middle of the image. It has been well documented/ complained about from this camera. I do not recommend this camera. Only as a last resort.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R. Messenger

customer_reviews.title: Not very tough
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes very good pictures, nevertheless is not very tough, at least not as advertised. It was bought for field work in the hope that it would last more than other cameras, but the zoom button broke after only 6 months of use without having fallen or having been misused (apparently the plastic got stressed and broke, image #3). The shoot button does not work properly either after the zoom broke off. For a "tough" camera, it does not hold up very good everyday work.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E.

customer_reviews.title: Slow and Cunbersome
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am not happy with the Olympus TG-5. The focus is slow, picture quality mediocre and the menu is a nightmare. I expected much more for the high price. I do not recommend this camera
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great rugged camera for the outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with too many features to name. The low light pictures are crystal clear. The only 2 issues are you can hear the zoom in the video's audio, and the panorama feature could use some work with stitching the images together. Other than that, it's a great point and shoot that you can drag through the mud or throw off a cliff.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Family

customer_reviews.title: Its been dunked and splashed a few times, but it is "Tough"!
customer_reviews.text: I always take it in my kayak and the pictures I take with it are awesome. Be sure to charge it up before each outing, keep the compartments locked up tight and rinse the outside case with clean water and pat dry before you put it away when you get home..
customer_reviews.author: Seeker

customer_reviews.title: the pics are very good, however
customer_reviews.text: the pics are very good, however, like other reviewers have noted, difficult to see which modes you are in for shots as the screen is super hard to see under water. I think over time one would get better using it. It's not the easiest camera to use, but again, reading the online manual and practicing with it ....
customer_reviews.author: Kasha Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, but short battery life
customer_reviews.text: This camera can take nice pictures on a snorkeling trip and even movies. The battery runs out quickly, though, and you won’t want to change out the battery in a wet situation.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera with snorkeling in mind. I first used at Catalina and took some amazing underwater shots. I took stills and movies at 15 feet with great clarity. It takes great pictures out of the water as well. It is a fun camera, easy to use and takes amazing pictures.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise, pictures turn out better then I hoped for a person who uses a DSLR mostly
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on my canoe trips and video was outstanding. No problems with taking pictures under water. This has become my regular hiking and canoeing camera.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Lingenfelter

customer_reviews.title: It’s made for adventure
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I would not like about it. Love it. Beautiful pictures in magnifying mode. I missed having a camera that I don’t have to worry about getting it wet. I love kayaking and taking pictures very close. This camera is small, never in my way and does a beautiful job. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Olah

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 Week and LED display broke
customer_reviews.text: Camera worked well taking pictures snorkeling. Climbing back into boat hit LED display on corner and cracked wiping out 2/3 of the LED viewing area. Had a screen protector on the display. Pictures were good underwater but tough it was not.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use, good quality and good price.
customer_reviews.text: I work in the field in Alaska everyday. This camera is a MUST HAVE for field scientists, it is an all-weather, night-time or day-time documentation tool, and it is fun to use. You can set the ISO for star light-only photographs on a tripod that are of useful (awesome). I highly recommend this camera. Did I say it is FUN to use? This thing is actually fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Really versatile point and shoot, great images.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the microscope capability for the inspection work that I do and for its waterproof capability because I have drowned at least 3 cameras. The quality of the exposures is better than my Canon EOS 70D SLR and it sure is less clunky. I think that Olympus must be using the great cell phone camera technology to improve their product. Battery life has been quite good.
customer_reviews.author: billb

customer_reviews.title: My carry everywhere camera.
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof, rugged, takes great photos...what's not to like. I'll look for a third party battery, I like to have a spare, and would like to find one with higher mAh rating.
customer_reviews.author: Edward F. Magowan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but did not last me long
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera March 2018 and pleasantly happy with it. I use it without housing in freedives since it is waterproof up to 15meters. I have an underwater housing for Scuba diving. I went freediving on October 2019 and i was surprised that it was flooded. It was a shallow dive of 5-8meters only. The camera stopped working and when I had it checked in a service center they found out that the boards are very rusty already :( Lasted me only a year.
customer_reviews.author: sTok

customer_reviews.title: We took some under water shots and they were great the microscope mode is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned the Tough 6000 and the TG 5 has improved a lot on some of the image quality issues especially with night shots. The issue I have with this camera is the sound of the mechanism on the zoom is heard in the recording and as previous views the auto zoom on the video is a bit slow. We took some under water shots and they were great the microscope mode is amazing. We love this camera. Had one issue in change of temperature and the lens fogged a bit but I am hoping that it was my error in changing the battery and the seal not seating properly as i haven't has a reoccurance.
customer_reviews.author: Deocharan

customer_reviews.title: A great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera because the colors come out vibrant especially on sunset mode. This camera works great at Antelope Canyon, underwater and caves. I have dropped the Olympus waterproof camera four times and it still works great. This camera is not for the experienced photographer, but for traveler who just want something light and takes great shots. Best to keep the setting on sunset mode all the time that works the best.
customer_reviews.author: Junie Baerwald

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: SO I HAVE HAD THIS CAMERA FOR LESS THAN A YEAR AND WITH IN THE FIRST FEW MONTHS THE ZOOM SWITCH BROKE AND THE PIECE THAT HOLD THE BATTERY IN PLACE BROKE OFF. I USE THIS CAMERA FOR WORK EVERYDAY AND FOR THE MONEY I SPENT ON IT I WISH IT WAS ACTUALLY TOUGH LIKE ITS SUPPOSED TO BE. NOW I NEED TO GET A DIFFERENT CAMERA WHEN I CAN AFFORD TO DO SO.
customer_reviews.author: zachary millar

customer_reviews.title: Still a good camera...
customer_reviews.text: I feel like my Olympus Stylus TG-830 that I bought in 2013 was better (when it was new). I do like this camera. Underwater pics were better on the old camera and for some reason the zoom is very loud on this camera...you will hear the zoom in your videos.
customer_reviews.author: ATau

customer_reviews.title: Nice Travel Camera that looks Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: I got my TG-5 for travel, for when a huge camera wasn't necessary or practical. I haven't used it for underwater, but it has good general and good macro photos. It also looks _very_ cool, which is a bonus. I've used the macro function on bugs and on documents.
customer_reviews.author: Colin L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Weak zoom, unreliable GPS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for doing insurance inspections where the client needs a GPS stamp on photos. Unfortunately, the GPS feature is unreliable; I can't be certain that pictures have GPS location until I view them on my home computer. Also the zoom feature is slow and only magnifies 5x
customer_reviews.author: David E Bauman

customer_reviews.title: Great to travel with.
customer_reviews.text: Took the camera on a couple holidays. Small enough to carry it in a pocket. The quality of the pics and video is good. On my first trip took thousands of pictures. Happy with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: JohnCanessa

customer_reviews.title: Dud
customer_reviews.text: After using for a few days and comparing side by side with my iPhone X I returned the camera. My phone takes far better pics and has a much better zoom. Was pretty let down by this camera. Wouldn’t recommend unless you need a Waterproof camera, and don’t care about the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Jon T. Severson

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Not the most user friendly. Hard to figure settings. The video portion comes out in slow motion at times. Camera is durable but does not hold battery in the cold
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Krise

customer_reviews.title: Perfect point and shoot for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Been all over the world with this camera and am very pleased with it. Small and discreet and loaded with features. Also have an underwater housing and have taken it on 40 dives or so. Performed wonderfully and very nice pictures have resulted.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Recluse

customer_reviews.title: this camera is "tough"
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. We are required to use cameras that have the GPS function, so our options are limited. We take hundreds to 1000s of pics a day, work outdoors in all conditions, and put these to the test,... so the cameras we use must be tough. This one can definitely take a shot. Only complaints I have are that the menu is not very user-friendly, and it is on the expensive side.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lambert

customer_reviews.title: I wish I knew...
customer_reviews.text: I can’t really judge anything about this camera. First time in the beach at Waikiki, one wave pulled the camera off the strap. I can tell ya the strap is completely worthless, but I can’t tell you anything about the image quality or face recognition or, well, anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rose

customer_reviews.title: Good all around, but 12mp has it's limits.
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera for being shock proof and weather proof. You notice the limits of having a 12mp sensor, but as an all around go anywhere camera that can get dunked, and shoot RAW, it's a nice camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jasen

customer_reviews.title: 100% works underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: Used in Red Sea many hours. Take lots of photos and videos. All works without problems. Sometimes not start video with message "battery is empty" but if try to start again - worked.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey K

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Gives up some zoom range for rugged self-contained package.
customer_reviews.author: William Franz

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this camera!
customer_reviews.text: The battery does not last long in fact I can barely take pictures of two properties( it was a purpose of me buying this camera was to take pictures of my properties when tenants move in and out) and the battery’s dead! Pay $500 for this camera not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased before going on a Caribbean vacation, knowing that we wanted to use the camera for snorkeling. We snorkeled about an hour each day, and the battery lasted fine. The picture quality is very good. The video camera worked beautifully. I am very happy and would highly recommend. (I have attached some pictures)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow I am super impressed. I am a semi pro photographer and ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow I am super impressed. I am a semi pro photographer and this camera is loaded with features. And it is waterproof, now I will use this camera at the pool, the lake or ocean. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures when it was working
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures when it was working. This is the third Olympus tough series camera that I have purchased and owned. The previous ones all worked great. This one worked for about 100 pictures, then it stopped. It refused to turn on even after I have charged the battery for more than 12 hours. I am not sure what is wrong,
customer_reviews.author: jspy

customer_reviews.title: A great Macro picture
customer_reviews.text: An excellent camera, it has everything you need; the microscope mode is incredible. Amazing pictures, and It is a perfect camera for both beginners and professionals. I would only add the option of full manual.
customer_reviews.author: Luis David Beltran Osorio

customer_reviews.title: battery life is very inferior to previous (similar) Olympus cameras
customer_reviews.text: Using this camera as a point and shoot on fishing trips -- This is the 3rd Olympus Tough -- or TG camera - I've owned -- this new one -- very poor battery life -- very slow to charge -- need to carry a spare battery to ensure I'll get photos in the afternoon. Lots of "warnings" -- I want to photo underwater -- and get too many messages about door not sealed -- when -- nothing can be seen on door seals. Overall -- wish the electronics of previous TG had not "died"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: This camera was awesome for snorkeling and hiking in the Galapagos. I can’t wait to pick up a scuba housing and try it while diving.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loved having this on our trip
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved having this on our trip! I highly recommend getting the attachment for attaching this to your backpack. It made life so much easier just unstrapping and shooting! Pictures turned out great and it was completely waterproof as described. Knocked it around the rocks while snorkeling in Mexico and no issues whatsoever! Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Qualitu and Toughness
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for a friend who needed a tough camera for Kayaking, hiking, and a trip to Africa!!! She loves it! If I was in mamrket for a tough camera this would be my choice!
customer_reviews.author: MartyMo

customer_reviews.title: Write Protect won’t take photos
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the camera for upcoming trip, and “Write” message Protect keeps popping up after numerous new San Disks installed with the write protect switch on scan disk turned off. Called customer service and have to send camera to NJ for repair. Camera won’t make it for the trip and the only reason why I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Shine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Camera for Underwater or Everyday Use
customer_reviews.text: After much searching I finally decided on this camera and I couldnt be happier. The under water pictures and video were clear and beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: FREDARANDA

customer_reviews.title: It it's not working at all, you probably have the battery in backwards. Or, you used it underwater with sand in the seal.
customer_reviews.text: Photo quality is great, movies are good (although focus is slow), and the wifi link to a phone via an app works with some coaxing. Too many doo-dads and options for my taste, but that's just me. Two big caveats: (1) using it underwater with even a single tiny grain of sand in the battery compartment seal will flood the camera. I learned this the hard way, and irreparably bricked my camera halfway thru a trip. (2) The battery can be inserted backwards just as easily as it can be inserted correctly, which makes the camera appear bricked when it isn't. A truly stupid design. With all this said, I bought an identical replacement for the flooded camera.
customer_reviews.author: BBEBB

product_meta.title: Olympus TG-5 Waterproof Camera with 3-Inch LCD, Red
product_meta.description: The Olympus Tough TG-5 is built for adventure and packed with professional features that help you nail bright, crisp outdoor shots even in challenging conditions. You’ll find imaging firepower that’s optimized for shooting action like a fast F2.0 Olympus lens, high-resolution raw stills, and spectacular Ultra HD 4K video. Microscope macro modes shoot high magnification stills of small subjects up to 1 cm from the lens, and nighttime live composite mode makes it easy to shoot incredible cityscapes and star trails. Action track sensors record location, temperature, direction, and altitude data that bring your images and video to life. The Tough TG-5 is waterproof, shockproof, crushproof, freeze proof, dustproof, and features anti-fog dual pane lens glass. No other camera handles so much abuse while producing stunning photography like the TG-5.
feature_bullets: New 12 megapixel Hi speed image sensor for improved low light performance and noise reduction
Underwater compensation: 2 EV to +2 EV (in 1/3 EV steps); Bright F2.0 high speed lens; Video recording format: MOV(MPEG 4AVC/H.264)
Dual quad core TruePic VIII image processor 3.0 inches 460k Dot LCD monitor; Focus range normal: 3.94 inches (10 centimeter) to infinit macro: 0.4 inches (1 centimeter) to infinity
Field sensor system with GPS, manometer, compass, and temperature sensors
Waterproof to 50 feet, F, dust proof, crush proof to 220 lbf, Shockproof from 7 feet, freeze proof to 14 degrees, anti fog lens, dust proof: IP6X

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars367 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
